intro: Symplocos flavescens var. flavescens, commonly known as the yellow alder, is a deciduous shrub native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and oval-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and mountainous regions. Its bark and leaves have been used in traditional medicine for their astringent properties. The species is noted for its ability to thrive in acidic soils and its role in forest succession.
